question: 1 (c)
sols_html:
Recall that

\(\text{cond}(A) = \left \| A \right \|\left \| A^{-1} \right \|\)

Now, since A is diagonal matrix, it is easy to find \(A^{-1}\).

\(A^{-1}=\begin{bmatrix} 1 &0 &0 \\ 0 & \frac{1}{a} &0 \\ 0& 0 & \frac{1}{2} \end{bmatrix}\)

If \(\left | a \right |> 1\), \(\left \| A^{-1} \right \| =1\) since \(\max\left \{ \left | 1 \right |,\left | \frac{1}{a} \right |,\left | \frac{1}{2} \right | \right \} =1\).

And \(\left \| A \right \|\geq 2\) since \(\max\left \{ \left | 1 \right |,\left | a \right |,\left | 2\right | \right \} \geq 2\).

Thus, \(\left \| A^{-1} \right \|\left \| A \right \| \geq 2.\)

Therefore, it is impossible to get \(\text{cond}(A) = \frac{1}{2}\).

If \(\left | a \right |\leq 1\), \(\left \| A \right \|=2\) since \(\max\left \{ \left | 1 \right |,\left | a \right |,\left | 2\right | \right \} =2\).

And \(\left \| A^{-1} \right \|\geq 1\) since \(\max\left \{ \left | 1 \right |,\left | \frac{1}{a} \right |,\left | \frac{1}{2} \right | \right \} \geq 1.\)

Thus, \(\left \| A^{-1} \right \|\left \| A \right \| \geq 2.\)

Hence, again it is impossible to get \(\text{cond}(A) = \frac{1}{2}\).

Therefore, there is no such value a which gives \(\text{cond}(A) =\frac{1}{2}\)
